Just in case anyone might be interested in the answer to my question:

http=
://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/dbunit/dbunit/docs/Attic/howto.html?rev=
=3D1.24

How to export data from or import data to "multiple database schem=
as"

Dbunit support multiple schemas per connection since version 1.2.3. To=

enable multiple schemas support, set the following system property
before =
the creation of your database connection.

      System.setProperty("dbunit=
.qualified.table.names", "true");

This tells to Dbunit to work with table =
names qualified by their
schema name. If this mode is enabled, all table na=
mes are assumed to
have this format: SCHEMA_NAME.TABLE_NAME.

Example of fl=
at xml dataset exported or imported when qualified table
names mode is enab=
led:

<dataset>
    <SCHEMA1.TABLE1 COLUMN0=3D"row 0 col 0" COLUMN1=3D"row =
0 col 1"/&
    <SCHEMA1.TABLE1 COLUMN0=3D"row 1 col 0" COLUMN1=3D"row 1 col=
 1"/>
    <SCHEMA2.TABLE2 COLUMN0=3D"row 0 col 0" COLUMN1=3D"row 0 col 1"
C=
OLUMN2=3D"row 0 col 2"/>
</dataset>

urn new DatabaseConnection(ds.getConnection(), "INVPO");
